data.name: Archer
data.description:
Cheap ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets.
+ High rate of fire
- Weak against armored targets
- Countered by Horsemen

data.name: Battering Ram
data.description:
Durable infantry transport effective against buildings and walls.
+ High ranged armor
+ High health
- Can only attack buildings
- Slow movement speed

variations.name: Battering Ram
variations.description:
Durable infantry transport effective against buildings and walls.
+ High ranged armor
+ High health
- Can only attack buildings
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Bombard
data.description:
Intimidating siege gun excellent against buildings or any stubborn targets.
+ High damage
- Must be set up to fire

variations.name: Bombard
variations.description:
Intimidating siege gun excellent against buildings or any stubborn targets.
+ High damage
- Must be set up to fire

data.name: Counterweight Trebuchet
data.description:
Powerful siege engine effective at destroying buildings and walls over a great distance.
+ Bonus damage vs buildings
- Must be set up to fire
- Inaccurate against units

variations.description:
Powerful siege engine effective at destroying buildings and walls over a great distance.
+ Bonus damage vs buildings

data.name: Culverin
data.description:
Long-range cannon made for destroying siege engines.
+ Bonus damage to siege weapons
+ Attacks without having to set up
- Low damage to buildings

variations.name: Culverin
variations.description:
Long-range cannon made for destroying siege engines.
+ Bonus damage to siege weapons
+ Attacks without having to set up
- Low damage to buildings

data.name: Demolition Ship
data.description:
Small ship packed with explosives. Detonates when killed, damaging any units in the area.
- Damage is reduced further from the explosion center
- No weapons other than self-destruction

variations.name: Demolition Ship
variations.description:
Small ship packed with explosives. Detonates when killed, damaging any units in the area.
- Damage is reduced further from the explosion center
- No weapons other than self-destruction

data.name: Donso
data.description:
Infantry best used against mounted units. Periodically throws a javelin when attacking from ranged.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
+ Comes with melee armor
- Weak against armored infantry
- Countered by Archers and Longbowmen

data.name: Fishing Boat
data.description:
Small boat that gathers Food from either Deep Water Fish or Shoreline Fish. Drops off gathered resources at the Dock.
+ Can repair
- No combat

variations.name: Fishing Boat
variations.description:
Small boat that gathers Food from either Deep Water Fish or Shoreline Fish. Drops off gathered resources at the Dock.

+ Increased maneuverability and speed.
+ Benefits from ranged damage Blacksmith technology

data.name: Imam
data.description:
Support unit with no combat capability. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites.
+ Heals friendly units
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Javelin Thrower
data.description:
Ranged infantry effective against other ranged units.
+ Anti-ranged specialist
+Increased weapon range
- Comes with ranged armor
- Low health
- Countered by Horsemen

+ Effective against massed units

data.name: Musofadi Warrior

Infantry effective at ambush attacks and countering heavy armored targets.
+ Can enter stealth
+ Anti-armor specialist
- Low health

+ Health regeneration
- Very weak in combat

data.name: Siege Tower

Tall infantry transport with no combat capability. Allows garrisoned infantry to be unloaded directly onto Stone Walls.
+ High ranged armor
- Cannot attack
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Sofa
data.description:
Cheaper heavy cavalry for reduced health and armor.
+ High movement speed
+ Cheaper cost
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

data.name: Trade Ship
data.description:
Trade Ships generate Gold and Wood when assigned to a trade route with a Coastal Trade Post or another player's Dock.
- No combat

variations.name: Trade Ship
variations.description:
Trade Ships generate Gold and Wood when assigned to a trade route with a Coastal Trade Post or another player's Dock.
- No combat

data.name: Trader
data.description: Traders generate Gold when assigned to trade with a Trade Post or another player’s Market. The distance between the trade target and Market determines the amount of Gold. Once assigned to trade, the Trader makes repeated trips between its Home Market and the trade target. You can assign a new Home Market if you wish to.

variations.name: Trader
variations.description: Traders generate Gold when assigned to trade with a Trade Post or another player’s Market. The distance between the trade target and Market determines the amount of Gold. Once assigned to trade, the Trader makes repeated trips between its Home Market and the trade target. You can assign a new Home Market if you wish to.

data.name: Transport Ship
data.description:
Large oared vessel able to transport land units across water.
+ Can be garrisoned by any unit
+ Attacks with javelins for each unit garrisoned
+ Uses sight range of units in garrison

variations.description:

+ Can be garrisoned by any unit
+ Attacks with javelins for each unit garrisoned
+ Uses sight range of units in garrison
